docs.snippet: Champagne drinkers in Britain - the biggest export market for bubbly - face higher prices next year as the impact of the shock Brexit vote on the British pound takes its toll, champagne industry executives warned....
docs.lead_paragraph: Champagne drinkers in Britain - the biggest export market for bubbly - face higher prices next year as the impact of the shock Brexit vote on the British pound takes its toll, champagne industry executives warned.

headline.main: Champagne Prices to Rise in UK in 2017 as Brexit Impact Bites
headline.print_headline: Champagne Prices to Rise in UK in 2017 as Brexit Impact Bites

docs.snippet: British consumers are downbeat about the economy's prospects next year, when higher inflation is likely to erode their spending power, a major survey showed on Thursday, despite signs that growth has remained robust since June's Brexit vote....
docs.lead_paragraph: British consumers are downbeat about the economy's prospects next year, when higher inflation is likely to erode their spending power, a major survey showed on Thursday, despite signs that growth has remained robust since June's Brexit vote.

headline.main: UK Consumers Gloomy About 2017's Looming Inflation and Brexit Talks-GfK
headline.print_headline: UK Consumers Gloomy About 2017's Looming Inflation and Brexit Talks-GfK

docs.snippet: British consumers are downbeat about the economy's prospects next year, when higher inflation is likely to erode their spending power, a major survey showed on Thursday, despite signs that growth has remained robust since June's Brexit vote....
docs.lead_paragraph: British consumers are downbeat about the economy's prospects next year, when higher inflation is likely to erode their spending power, a major survey showed on Thursday, despite signs that growth has remained robust since June's Brexit vote.

headline.main: UK Consumers Gloomy About 2017's Looming Inflation and Brexit Talks-GfK

docs.snippet: A group of British and Irish lawyers are seeking to challenge Britain's decision to leave the European Union in the Irish High Court to try to establish if Brexit can be reversed once divorce talks have been triggered....
docs.lead_paragraph: A group of British and Irish lawyers are seeking to challenge Britain's decision to leave the European Union in the Irish High Court to try to establish if Brexit can be reversed once divorce talks have been triggered.

headline.main: Lawyers Seek to Launch Fresh Brexit Challenge in Irish Courts
headline.print_headline: Lawyers Seek to Launch Fresh Brexit Challenge in Irish Courts

docs.snippet: Mutual membership in the European Union had helped Britain and Ireland repair their relationship. Now, Britain’s vote to leave the union promises to redefine it....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mutual membership in the European Union had helped Britain and Ireland repair their relationship. Now, Britain’s vote to leave the union promises to redefine it.
docs.abstract: One of unintended consequences of British vote to leave European Union will be broad redefinition of relationship between Britain and Ireland, which became close despite historical animosities in part because of two countries' shared membership in EU.

headline.main: A Question Lingers on the Irish Border: What’s Next?
headline.print_headline: ‘Brexit’ Complications Dredge Up Faint Whiff of the Troubles

docs.snippet: Juan Jasso, 38, said his views had not been changed by the xenophobic insults he endured on a tram in Manchester....
docs.lead_paragraph: Juan Jasso, 38, said his views had not been changed by the xenophobic insults he endured on a tram in Manchester.
docs.abstract: Interview with Juan Jasso, Mexican-American who has lived in England for 18 years and was captured on video being verbally assaulted by racist tirade on commuter tram in which references were made to so-called Brexit vote; incident is viewed by many as example of profound social and political divisions being exposed across Britain following vote to leave European Union.

headline.main: Victim of Racist Taunts in England: A Mexican-American Who Backs ‘Brexit’
headline.print_headline: A Victim in England Dismantles Assumptions

docs.snippet: The country has a few options for how it might remain in the European Union. Each carries significant risks — but, then again, so does leaving....
docs.lead_paragraph: The country has a few options for how it might remain in the European Union. Each carries significant risks — but, then again, so does leaving.
docs.abstract: Max Fisher The Interpreter column explores four ways Great Britain can remain in European Union, despite referendum voting to leave.

headline.print_headline: Four Ways to Back Out of Leaving — and the Risks a Reversal May Involve

docs.snippet: Internal criticism of the leader, Jeremy Corbyn, led to his firing the shadow foreign secretary, and at least 11 other members of the party’s cabinet resigned....
docs.lead_paragraph: Internal criticism of the leader, Jeremy Corbyn, led to his firing the shadow foreign secretary, and at least 11 other members of the party’s cabinet resigned.
docs.abstract: Britain's vote to leave European Union splits opposition Labour Party, which sees flurry of resignations and firing of shadow foreign secretary ahead of no-confidence vote for leader Jeremy Corbyn; governing Conservatives suffer similar fracture, underscoring political instability introduced by prospect of country's exit from bloc.

headline.main: Fractures From ‘Brexit’ Vote Spread Into Opposition Labour Party
headline.print_headline: Labour Party Eruptsin Revolt as Head Is Challenged

docs.snippet: The British pound and stock prices plummeted, there was immediate pressure for another referendum on Scottish independence, and David Cameron said he would resign by October....
docs.lead_paragraph: The British pound and stock prices plummeted, there was immediate pressure for another referendum on Scottish independence, and David Cameron said he would resign by October.
docs.abstract: Great Britain's decision to leave European Union will cost Prime Min David Cameron his job, leaving his legacy forever tarnished; withdrawal also leaves country exposed to possible economic downturn and signals step away from multiculturalism that those who supported remaining in Europe say has made Britain among Europe’s most vibrant societies.

headline.main: ‘Brexit’ Aftershocks: More Rifts in Europe, and in Britain, Too
headline.print_headline: Cameron to Quit as E.U. Aims for Rebirth
